meanings.definition: Make or become dull or heavy.
meanings.sent1: The rain was leadening the mood of the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The long lecture was leadening my interest.
meanings.sent3: His leadening jokes always made us groan.
meanings.sent4: The leadening clouds hung low in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The leadening weight of the backpack slowed him down.

meanings.definition: To make or become slower or less lively.
meanings.sent1: The tiredness was leadening her steps.
meanings.sent2: The music's tempo was leadening as it reached the end.
meanings.sent3: The leadening turtle race was surprisingly intense.
meanings.sent4: Her leadening progress in the marathon was steady.
meanings.sent5: The leadening pace of the snail was comical to watch.

meanings.definition: To cover or fill with lead or a similar substance.
meanings.sent1: The artist was leadening the pencil for a darker shade.
meanings.sent2: The storm was leadening the roof with heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: She playfully tried leadening her friend's drink with sugar.
meanings.sent4: The leadening of the ship's hull made it more stable.
meanings.sent5: The leadening of the paint gave it a rich texture.
